ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I LEARNED SO MUCH! I didn't think I would enjoy this class that much, but I truly ended up learning a lot!
Better analytical skills and writing skills.
Critical thinking, close reading, formulating strong arguments, and learned many eye opening things about this particular subject, Sound, Race and Diaspora
Skills in close reading, writing, and complex discussion on colonization and diaspora!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: No outright weaknesses. Interesting course with manageable readings and workload.

Strengths: Our class was focused on discussion of texts, allowing us to deeply engage with the readings as well as our peers. I really enjoyed this aspect because of the many interesting readings we had and the chance to not only practice developing your thoughts to share with the class but to build on them through the dialogue created with your peers ideas.
Rasheed told us during class that our discussion of a particular reading was essentially a group creation of an essay. Very engaging class

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: absolutely! even if you don't have a lot of knowledge about music, its super interesting.
Yes, especially if you have interest in music and ethnic studies.

Highly! Especially with Rasheed. I would highly recommend this topic in particular if you are interested in music at all. I would even go as far to say that the topics of this class would be very interesting and essential for anyone to learn since we all interact in a world that produces sound!
Yes! Especially for those interested in music and its cultural / social impact on people!
Yes, fantastic to get writing credit.
